page.title: 06THE RHUBARB INDUSTRY
page.content: UNTIL RECENTLY OUTWOOD WAS IN THE CENTRE OF THE MAIN AREA IN ENGLAND FOR THE PRODUCTION OF RHUBARB. WHOLE FIELDS WERE TO BE SEEN GROWING NOTHING ELSE. IN THESE FIELDS COULD BE SEEN LONG LOW SHEDS WHICH WERE USED FOR 'FORCING' THE CROP, QUICKENING THE GROWING PROCESS AND GETTING IT READY FOR THE MARKET. TRAINS WOULD LEAVE LOCAL STATIONS EACH DAY TAKING THE PRODUCT DOWN TO COVENT GARDEN MARKET IN LONDON. SOME WAS EVEN SENT FOR EXPORT. PRODUCTION IS NOW DECLINING AND THE FIELDS ARE TURNED OVER TO HOUSING DEVELOPMENT, OR IN OUR IMMEDIATE LOCALITY, BUILDING A LIGHT INDUSTRIAL ESTATE FOR SUCH THINGS AS WAREHOUSING AND DISTRIBUTION, OR COMPUTER PARTS.
